choices: I'm Male
I'm Female
1.content:
Do not fear the dark, my child, for it may never hurt you. But be steadfast of the horrors that dwell within it, for they may consume you. These are the words that my father passed to me, as I now pass to you. Little did I know the importance of these words.

In the real world monsters are myth. They don't exist.
The only monsters that you would see are in horror movies or in cheesy romance stories where werewolfs can't seem to keep their shirts on. Everything is all hunky-dory.

Now lets talk about my world, the world that I never wanted to know about. The world that changed me. In this world, monsters DO exist, the things that go bump in the night are beings that we thought only existed in our dreams and the "Real" world is none the wiser.

Now you're in my world. The world that humanity thought had died long ago and had been turned into old wives tales.
What you decide to do with this knowledge is up to you, but as you read my journal, know this. Humanity has, for over 300 years, lived alongside these creatures. whether they know it or not. Not every one of these beings wish to harm humans. I found this out the hard way, I had befriended one of their kind and now the order has issued my death warrant. Time has betrayed me and soon I will be gone. Another "Martyr for the cause. A hero that died fighting God's mistakes". Those words are poison on my tongue now.

I leave this journal to whatever poor sap finds it.

Good luck.

Matthew Thompson~
December 29th 2013

______________________________________________________________

I found this book two years ago....

I thought it was the writings of a madman. A dusty old book in a box, left out next to a yard-sale sign.
But after reading it, I began to notice things.

I've had the strangest feeling that I'm being watched for almost a week now and it's maddening.

I've even caught myself "Scanning the room". thinking that I may find something that would prove that I wasn't crazy
but all in vain.

I've read and re-read that journal. There was that entry from the author, Matthew Thompson,
then there were other parts that I couldn't make out but something is telling me that there's more to it.
Was I mad for believing some of the stuff in that book? or was I mad for ignoring it?

Something tells me I'm about to find out real soon....
Someone -or something- was knocking at my door, and people don't normally
come to visit me, let alone at 3:00 A.M.


Okay, as per the usual interactive, I have to ask...
1.title: The night is dark...

choices: This person needs help. Open the door!
I don't think I should trust them... Leave it shut, for now.
No way! Ignore them intirely.
11.content:
Alright, good to know. Anyway, Back to the story!


You walk downstairs, slowly and cautiously.
You can hear the pounding of heavy rain outside,
the sound of thunder and the sudden flash of lightning only seem to grow louder as you walk.

"Hello?" you hear from the other side of the door "Is anyone in there? Hello?"

You can hear them say something else, but that was all you could make out over the sound
of the weather outside.

You sit there, wondering about whether or not you should let them in, whoever they are....

"Please, let me in!" they say "Please open the door!" They say, sounding distraught.

What should you do?
11.title: Knock knock

choices: She runs in and slams the door.
You help her in and get her a towel.
She attacks you!?
111.content:
They may be in danger. You can't stand by when someone is literally begging you to help them. From what? Maybe just from the storm outside. But it didn't really matter. You move down the staircase a bit more quickly now. A few more steps and you were at the door, sleeping pants and all.
You reach to open the door and feel the sense that something isn't right, you hesitate...

"Somebody, please!" you hear.

No turning back now.You open the door. A woman is standing in front of you, hair and shoulders soaked from the rain, her arms crossed in front of her to keep herself warm. She had black hair and wore a red sweater that was drenched. Her mascara was running down her cheeks.

"Are you okay?" you ask.

She looks up...
111.title: Inviting a stranger.

choices: A long sleep after
The Truth brings fire to the decievers
1111.content:
As soon the lock was turned, a force far greater than you ever expected busted through the door, and slamming it shut as quickly as it opened. The impact had pushed you further away than you thought. almost 4 feet from your front door, you were practically in your living room. You got up quickly to see a girl. She was panting hard. Her jacket had tears and fine cuts. It looked like she had to crawl under a fence and into barbed wire to make it look that bad. She leaned against the door frame. You went into the kitchen and grabbed the tallest cup of water you had, as you were a writer, you had coffee brewing, the smell was strong, but it was not ready, maybe you would not need it tonight. "What a waste" you thought as you ready two cups for later. You fill the glass with as much water as possible and bring a jug of water just in case. You hear her panting, still at the door, only this time she had slid down it a was at rest. Knees curled up to her face, arms wrapped around tightly. You could see her now. A tall Girl, certainly taller than you. She looked to be tall and lanky, but she definitely had some power behind that girly visage. Her body was drenched in sweat, Her hair was matted and sticking all over her face. The dyed blue hair was cut to be just a tad above the lower back. As you moved closer you noticed she was in a state of shock. Her eyes, you thought just for a moment looked like a predators. You stopped and blinked quickly, "I must be really drained", You think to your self.

"Here."

You hand her the water. and she begins to chug it with great ferocity. She lets a good portion of it run down her chin and checks, flowing other her shirt and chest. She rubs the water on her skin around her neck and arms. She calms here breathing, all the while you stand above her, just watching, giving her time to collect her self. After a few minutes of rest she stands up. With a shaky voice. She begins to attempt a thank you.

"Th- Th-Thank you. You have no idea how much this means to me. I was so scared. I-I-I." She Stutters, abruptly stopping and starting. With standing up now, you can clearly see her in more detail. She WAS clearly taller than you, by a good lead. At least 6'3. She had a body that had shape to it. her hips and thighs were shapely. Curved, toned with muscles, her abdomen was a six pack. You would had many words in your vocabulary, but those just seemed to not be enough to vividly describe her strange, powerful, yet oddly attractive frame. Looking up, Her face was beautiful; Green eyes, so deep you could lose your self in them. Her face and body had a cover of dense freckles, they only exalted her model further. As She moved towards you, you could she her eyes, flowing with water. She grabs you and hold tightly. You stammer back. Realizing the full power she possesses you think to yourself, "If she is this strong, then what on god's blue earth could make her this scared." She has one hand clamped on your shoulder at what you assume is full power. As your face contorts into one of pain, she pulls you in to her embrace tightly; this is apparently how shocked she is, to trust the first stranger who showed her kindness, you could do more harm to now that she is vulnerable. Yet if she was to fight back, you instinctively push these thoughts away. Because if she did choose to fight you, or do anything to you, What 'could' you do?

"Lets sit down on the couch. Its better than standing here all night." You say, even though your left arm feels like you should take her and your self to the doctor.

"Oh, yes, please." She she says in a more relaxed state. After a moments hesitation, she loosens her grip on you, but she does not let you go. This problem seems to be more than trust related now. She has released her death grip on you, but that did not give you back freedom.

You lead her to your couch, a large 'L' shaped thing. After a Nice year of sales thanks your moderately successful book series "After the sun goes down", They were based off the journal you found in that yard sale. You had to admit; who ever wrote it and left those notes had plenty of ideas and other sparks that certainly were unheard of, let alone sane. This couch was certainly big enough for both of you. Letting you lean into the corner while she stayed wrapped around you. After a period of silence, she began to speak up. This time she just seemed to use You as a barrier, or more to the point a security pillow.

"Can I stay here, for the night, or the day? Please." She looked at you with big eyes, still freshly made red with her crying. Although it was over, her trauma might be permanent.

"Yeah, that's fine. Do you need to shower too?" You interject quickly. As you could smell her body and clothes, which other than the pants below the naval and above the knees were mostly cut into pieces.

"Yeah, thank you, um.... My shit and jacket. I, uh."

"You can borrow one of my hoodies and sweat pants. I don't mind it just take your time." Your captor lets you stand up with very little resistance and follow you into deeper into your house. After passing into a guest room you lead her to its bathroom. you leave her alone here and return with two towels, a grey hoodie that is a little to large on you, and some track pants. The water is running already, as you enter the bathroom, you place it on the rack out side the shower room and leave to the kitchen. "Maybe some breakfast will help her." You think to yourself as you begin to make a basic breakfast of eggs, pancakes, and, bacon.

"Sigh, what a night...." You mutter after cracking an egg. The fear she had on her face, the strength she showed, and, the idea that what ever monster outside your door could do that to a woman that strong, it sent a chill through your body. The journal, all of contents were replaying through your mind. The monsters inside our world, hidden, praised, worshiped, and, hunted. "Matthew, I don't know know who or what you are, but it was all fiction? Right?" You say aloud. No response from your self. It was just you had become so paranoid lately, so much so your editor had begun to try and get you some psychiatric help. You hater her, unfortunately her existence, was necessary for you to live. After finishing the pancake batter you leave your thoughts alone to focus.

********************************************************
After forty minutes and a freshly made breakfast finished at five a.m, she appeared looking for you, calling out to you from the guest room. She walked in cleaned up and refreshed. Her attitude was better, The scared girl was now a calm collected lady, who to your surprise had glasses on her, her face was certainly showing abetter mood and she smiled weakly, but it was a small token of trust from her. The blue hair was brushed back with a pocket comb she said she carried it was in a neatly tucked and lose braid, over her left shoulder. She had some scratches on her legs that you patched up and applied hydrogen peroxide to. There were so many you put bandages around her ankles. She slightly blushed when you had to stand up. You clothes was a little tight in some areas, but the hoodie she wore was too much. It was a baggy unbelievable mess. It was too large for you and it gripped her perfectly. More than anything to essentially made it a one piece. The body part was too long, on you it went below your waist and too your shins. But on her, the red, white, and black monster fit perfectly covering her body just right. You could see the outlines of her strong feminine body, her tall body was accented by it, the legs, while damaged. you only had one thought; "legs for days.". They were well taken care of and shaved recently. IT was a shame that she had to be in such a state and put through this night.

"Thanks for the food. I don't normally have guys making me food this early." She said between bites. Smiling bigger than ever.

"Its fine, you look better and frankly you need something else to help you rest." you replied after a swig of coffee.

"Thanks, Oh, am Emily Drakaina, and thanks again." She said it with a giggle of sorts. The heart warming kind. But your mind went back to Matthew's journal, Drakaina. It was a entry from the journal More specifically a dangerous to many people. Her smile was bright, her manners so far were good. But that felling of paranoia was back, except, the dread was far, far greater now.

"I suppose I should tell you my name now, Its Jacob Skyler." You manage to say after a very unusual long and big sip of coffee followed by a tactical maneuver of eating pancakes. You grin at her direction, and she gives another giggle. Her body may be a tall fighter, but you remind yourself that humans can be monsters too, trying to push the ideas spawned from the journal back. Soon your having a pleasant conversation with Emily. It has both of you chatting. You tell her how you failed at the university on the other side of town. She tells you that she is a student there now, and majors in archeology. The surprises come from topic to another. The biggest blow to you is that she has read your books, and can now brag to her sister about meeting the author of their favorite book series. The fact your more popular than you realize is shocking. Turns out your evil editor can lie to you. She Tells you about a the math professor Dr.Kall, the fossil is still breathing and teaching at eighty-eight years old. Both of you laugh loudly, and soon your moved to the couch with blankets out. As the sunrise shoots light into your windows, the drapes catch most of it the cracks of light are slowly luring both of you to sleep on that couch. Emily Leans close to you and you stretch out your arms for her, she lays in and cuddles closer to you. You cast her smile and she returns it. He giantess frame for all of its raw power and beauty is only downplayed by her cute personality.
1111.title: She runs in and slams the door.

choices: Emmett Linch, a young private first class coming back with PTSD
Jonathen Black, a middle age preist
Carrie Newhouse , a docter
1112.content:
" Are you ok mam" you say putting your hand on her back. You lightly push her in to your house to get her out of the doorway. She bended over coughing trying to catch her breath.
She put her hand on you" thank you oh thank you for helping me" and looks up at you

. She was the most beautiful thing you have ever seen her eyes were the catcher. Her eyes were as grey as a story cloud and she had the face of a angle. " Oh mmm...... let me get you a towel you must be soaked"

you say giving her comfort. You point to the couch " you can sit there" and you walk upstairs to closet.

When you go back down she was standing pacing around your couch. "Here you go" and handed her a blue towel. She takes it and wipes her face off and you get a better look at her. She had black hair with gray strands of hair too you gaze at her body you look at her up and down. Insted of thinking of what happened to her you were think of her breast size.

She finishes drying and handes it back. " Thank you sir"

" Hey don't mention it " as you put your hand on your head " would you like something to eat".
" Ummmmm......... sure I guess" she answers you.
You walk in the kitchen and flick on the light showing a nice oak carved table " I can make some noodles if you want"

"Yea that would be nice" she says and walk to a chair. She truned around to sit down and you notice a claw mark on her back like she was attacked by a bear .............or a wolf??

You get a skilet from your cabnit and got the noodles from the pantry. " So may I ask what a lady like you doing out here in weather like this " She turned around and looks at you " My car crashed on the side of the road I craweled out and walked here". You stir the noodles around while listening to her story you were amazed to her that she survived a car crash and ran 3 miles to your house.

You walk to her with a bowel of noodles and place it enfront of you. "So I didn't get your name"
" My name is Sarah Clay and yours is................"
1112.title: You help her in and get her a towel.

choices: You get attack in the middle of the night
In the morning you go down stairs and Sarah is gone
11121.content:
"Private First Class Emmett reporting for duty" I do in a goofy way and giving a fake salute. She giggles in the sexiest way" Private First Class what are doing back here" she responds. I roll up my shirt showing my six pack and point to a part of your upper body” you see this scar this was my ticket home”.
She puts her hand under her chin” what happened”?


“ A piece of flaming shrapnel went straight through my lung and sadly I can’t do anything about it,” I say rolling your shirt down “ I have a hard time breathing sometimes but I’m taking some pills to help with the pain,” He says making a smile. She gets up from the chair and walks to you and looks you in the eye. Once again looking at her eyes were just memorizing as they lustered in the light.
“ Im sorry for ya”

“Don’t be you couldn't have done anything and I knew the risk”

“Speaking of not knowing anything what you I mean I just let a random stranger into my home” gesturing your hands.

“My car crashed on the side of the road, I could barely see when a deer crossing the road and I didn’t want to hit it.

You laugh finding it hilarious but stop when she crosses her arms. “ Well, we can go get your car when the tomorrow”.

Sarah raises her eyebrow “ you're going to let me stay”?

“Well yeah mean I wouldn’t want you to go out in that” pointing outside.

I go to the closet to make a makeshift bed on the couch. “ I’m going to be the third room from the stairs if you need anything,” I tell her.

She smirks at you and gives you a thumbs up” goodnight”.

You walk up the stairs to your room and get in, you take off your shirt and exchanged your pants for shorts. As you begin to lay down in bed you move your hand under a shelf to pull out an M1911 and put it under your pillow. You slowly drift off into a deep slumber.
11121.title: Emmett Linch, a young private first class comin...

choices: Stay and be quiet
Go answer the door
Something happens before you decide
Reader's choice
Reader's choice
12.content:
My heart skips a beat. I inhale quickly and deeply. Who the hell could that be? Especially at this ungodly hour. Should I open the door or remain in bed, be as still and quiet as possible and hope the unknown unexpected caller would leave. As I pondered these questions, the caller knocked.
I sighed. I had to make up my mind, I knew, but making a decision was so hard with such unknowns.
12.title: I'm Female

choices: Open the door and let him use the phone.
Refuse to let him in but offer him your cellphone to use.
Lie and say you don't have any form of contact with other people.
122.content:
I walk up to the door and try and see who is there. Only a silhouette is visible standing in front of the door, and that is about all you can make out. It's times like this you curse your laziness in fixing the front porch light. The figure isn't moving and hasn't said anything to you.

"Yes, can I help you sir?"

A male voice comes through the door and reaves your ears.

"Ah! So someone is home after all? Splendid. Yes, my name is Marco and my car broke down about a mile down the road. I do feel bad about disturbing you at this ungodly hour but this seems to be the only residence around. Might you be kind enough to let me use your phone?"

The person wasn't hesitating or stuttering which leads you to believe he is earnest. That said, you decide to...
122.title: Go answer the door

info.brief_description: Monsters exist. Do you hunt them? Or join them?
info.description:
Monsters exist all around us. They could be your doctor, your local grocery clerk, your creepy neighbor that never seems to leave home. Creatures that lust for blood and god knows what else.

What will you do with this knowledge?

Become a slayer? Join the monsters? or something in between?

You decide.

A few rules before we begin

>As per my usual for interactives, I prefer to make the reader out as the lead character.
This is optional but please leave the choice to do so.

>No adding chapters that would end the story. Keep it going!

>I have a zero-tolerance for 1337 text. (lol, omg, wtf, etc.) Unless it would actually make sense to, such as receiving a text message.

>Please use your best grammar

>No using any non-original characters, such as Naruto or Goku.

>As per the usual, romance is allowed and encouraged. It is NOT an erotica

>This may have a 13+ rating, but blood and death should be expected.

>I retain the right to "Prune" any chapters that are unreadable or make no sense.

Other than that, have fun and enjoy.
